title: Sustainable Logistics: Navigating the Path of a Green Supply Chain - Supply and Demand Chain Executive
summary: The article speaks to the evolution of supply chain management in the context of sustainability, emphasizing the crucial role of green supply chain practices in minimizing environmental impacts and maximizing economic value. By integrating electric vehicles, adopting circular economy principles, and leveraging advanced technologies, companies can achieve significant environmental benefits, such as lower emissions, reduced waste, and increased operational efficiency.
green_innovation: TRUE, as the article describes green supply chain practices that contribute to environmental sustainability by minimizing waste and maximizing the lifespan of products and materials.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the article describes the integration of electric vehicles and the adoption of circular economy principles in supply chain management, which represent new or improved processes that differ significantly from previous practices and have been brought into use by companies.
green_product: TRUE, as the article mentions the focus on product design and materials to minimize waste and maximize the lifespan of products, which is a characteristic of green products.
green_process: TRUE, as the article describes the adoption of circular economy principles, which involve reusing and recycling materials and products throughout the supply chain, thus minimizing waste and promoting sustainability.

greenwashing: The article does not provide any evidence of greenwashing practices.
